intro: Tournefortia bicolor subvar. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with prominent stamens, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for ornamental gardening. Its adaptability and aesthetic appeal contribute to its popularity in horticultural settings.
